title: Turkey and Spinach Meatballs
directions: Melt coconut oil in a pan over medium heat. Add spinach to the pan, stirring constantly, until wilted. Remove from heat, and set aside to cool.

Preheat oven to 400ÂºF. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Combine turkey, almond flour, egg, seasonings, and cooled spinach in a bowl. Mix well using hands. Form mixture into 16 meatballs and bake for 25 minutes. One serving will be 4 meatballs (each meatball counts as 1 protein).

Following Belly Buster or The Next 14 Days of Supercharged Meal Plans? Make this recipe during Week 1. Freeze half of the batch (8 meatballs). To defrost during Week 2, pull them out of the freezer the night before eating them OR defrost them in a pan with coconut oil on very low heat (takes about 15 minutes).
ingredients: 1 tsp. coconut oil, raw, extra-virgin, organic
1 lbs. turkey, ground, grass-fed or pastured, organic
1/4 tsp. sea salt, unrefined and pure
